page.title: 03Parbold Hilldale Roads
page.content: The main road from Parbold to Hilldale is the B5246,continuing north west it leads to Rufford.In the areas nearest to the main housing estates there are pavements along either side of the road.On the minor roads there are very few pavements,there are grass verges or hedgerows bordering the roads.These side roads are narrower,and tend to be more winding than the main road.Signs clearly indicate the many PUBLIC FOOTPATHS,pointing in the direction and stating the distance to villages and farms.One footpath went round a small lake where ducklings swam towards the island in the middle.Many footpaths go through fields,some through woodland.Many footpaths lead up to an old windmill,several go through the land at Harrock Hall.The footpaths seem well worn so must be well-used.
